abstract.text: A GeoJSON data source.
An image data source.
A property to use as a feature id. An expression can be used to dynamically check multiple properties.
Describes a Custom Raster Source to be used in the style.
Douglas-Peucker simplification tolerance (higher means simpler geometries and faster performance).
Default value: 0.375.
Struct of supported Source Types
Docs : https://docs.mapbox.com/mapbox-gl-js/style-spec/sources/
A vector tile source.
A protocol used to create any type of  map style content, such as layers, sources, lighting and others.
Data for a specific CustomRasterSource tile.
A raster array source
Information about a Source

Size of the tile buffer on each side. A value of 0 produces no buffer. A value of 512 produces a buffer as wide as the tile itself. Larger values produce fewer rendering artifacts near tile edges and slower performance.
Default value: 128. Value range: [0, 512]
A URL to a GeoJSON file, or inline GeoJSON.
If the data is a collection of point features, setting this to true clusters the points by radius into groups. Cluster groups become new
features in the source with additional properties:
Minimum number of points necessary to form a cluster if clustering is enabled. Defaults to
Options for custom raster source.
A URL to a GeoJSON file, or inline GeoJSON.
Maximum zoom level at which to create vector tiles (higher means greater detail at high zoom levels).
Default value: 18.

When loading a map, if PrefetchZoomDelta is set to any number greater than 0, the map will first request a tile at zoom level lower than zoom - delta, but so that the zoom level is multiple of delta, in an attempt to display a full map at lower resolution as quick as possible. It will get clamped at the tile source minimum zoom.
Default value: 4.
A GeoJSON data source.

When set to true, the maxZoom property is ignored and is instead calculated automatically based on the largest bounding box from the geoJSON features. This resolves rendering artifacts for features that use wide blur (e.g. fill extrusion ground flood light or circle layer) and would bring performance improvement on lower zoom levels, especially for geoJSON sources that update data frequently. However, it can lead to flickering and precision loss on zoom levels above 19.
Default value: false.
A property to use as a feature id. An expression can be used to dynamically check multiple properties.
Contains an attribution to be displayed when the map is shown to a user.
Captures potential values of the
property of a GeoJSONSource.
Callback for changing a CustomRasterSource tile status.
A raster tile source.
The encoding used by this source. Mapbox Terrain RGB is used by default
Denotes promote-id setting for
A protocol describing a style-related entity that can be decoded.
A RGB-encoded raster DEM source
Radius of each cluster if clustering is enabled. A value of 512 indicates a radius equal to the width of a tile.
Default value: 50. Minimum value: 0.

This property defines a source-specific resource budget, either in tile units or in megabytes. Whenever the tile cache goes over the defined limit, the least recently used tile will be evicted from the in-memory cache. Note that the current implementation does not take into account resources allocated by the visible tiles.

When loading a map, if PrefetchZoomDelta is set to any number greater than 0, the map will first request a tile at zoom level lower than zoom - delta, but so that the zoom level is multiple of delta, in an attempt to display a full map at lower resolution as quick as possible. It will get clamped at the tile source minimum zoom.
Default value: 4.
Callback to do various operations for tile.
For example, fetching a tile or cancelling a tile request.
Interactive, thoroughly customizable maps for iOS powered by vector tiles and Metal.
Describes a Custom Geometry Source to be used in the style
Interface for the direct rendering into the custom raster tiles.
CustomRasterSource tile status.
Defines a TileCacheBudgetSize, which can be set as either a megabyte or tile count limit.
Whenever tile cache goes over the defined limit
the least recently used tile will be evicted from the in-memory cache
Influences the y direction of the tile coordinates. The global-mercator (aka Spherical Mercator) profile is assumed.
Options for custom geometry source.
Whether to calculate line distance metrics. This is required for line layers that specify
values.
Default value: false.
An object defining custom properties on the generated clusters if clustering is enabled, aggregating values from clustered points. Has the form
is any expression function that accepts at least 2 operands (e.g.
or
) — it accumulates the property value from clusters/points the cluster contains;
produces the value of a single point.
A protocol describing a style-related entity that can be encoded.
Whether to generate ids for the GeoJSON features. When enabled, the
property will be auto assigned based on its index in the
array, over-writing any previous values.
Default value: false.

This property defines a source-specific resource budget, either in tile units or in megabytes. Whenever the tile cache goes over the defined limit, the least recently used tile will be evicted from the in-memory cache. Note that the current implementation does not take into account resources allocated by the visible tiles.

Max zoom on which to cluster points if clustering is enabled. Defaults to one zoom less than maxzoom (so that last zoom features are not clustered). Clusters are re-evaluated at integer zoom levels so setting clusterMaxZoom to 14 means the clusters will be displayed until z15.
